page.title: 11RELIGION
page.content: At Theberton is an Anglican church with round tower and thatched roof. It is one of a group of 4 in a 34 mile territory served by one rector so services are not regular. No social group is attached, such as Mothers' Union or girl guides or boy scouts. Some Anglicans with children attend Saxmundham church, for this with larger congregation offers other activities and youth groups. However, in Leiston there is a Quaker meeting house, a Methodist church in Kelsale, a Baptist church near Aldringham and a Catholic church at Leiston - none far away for a car owning community to attend the place of their choice. A proportion of the population attend church regularly, whilst some are just nominally christians, but most live by Christian ethics.
